intro: Trigonotis inoblita var. archboldii, commonly known as the Hawaiian iron vine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters along the stems. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
